about_the_game:
Welcome to Synthesis Universe - Story -

An incredible story within a Musical civilization.
Every notes, every beat is alive and surrounds you.


Episode 00 is about you, who are you in that story: a witness from the future
A Music album: each sequence is a story moment, inspired by the structure of the music.



Feeling the beat!


  • 7 Music tracks.
  • 4 main sequences + 3 extra.
  • A Hub and a Timeline room (Containing the 3 extra)
  • This is not a game, even if the world is aware of your actions.
  • Expect a unique level of immersion, no menu or text, pure true VR interactions.



Take your time! Look around: the world is aware of your actions & will reward you.
CAUTION: Built entirely for VR:
Standing strongly recommended, 360 necessary sometimes.
(Playing seated is possible but not optimal)
Can be played just standing up, even with very limited play space!
Try to go off bounds!
Mostly gaze activated, the motion controllers are not much used in Episode 00
Play time should be about 30 minutes, but time is not limited.

Key and button in game:
M: Toggle screen mirror mode ON/OFF
Pressing Both sticks: Recenter/reorient view.
Esc: Quit
detailed_description:
Update Notes

V2.5 is Live! New Room, new menu system to pause & re-calibrate. Latest LIV sdk support!
V2.4 Coming soon (Q2-3 2021) -Minor optimization update-
V2.1 January 6th 2020: LIV full support.
Press L to toggle Full LIV Post process On/OFF (LIV V1)

V2.0 Dec 12th 2019 update adds 3 tracks and 2 rooms to the main hub:
-Robot building: a retake on SU most famous track/experience.
-Training room: a place to chill out and meditate.
-Fragment Memory 01 (available in the Timeline room in Episode X)

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows 8.1
  • Processor: Intel i5-4590 / AMD Ryzen 5 1500X or greater
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 970 / AMD Radeon R9 580 or greater
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 2250 MB available space
  • VR Support: SteamVR. Standing or Room Scale
